alert.note: Alert for Mora (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 22 at 1:42PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall over the northwest tip of the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon burn scar is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast New Mexico, including the following counties, in north central New Mexico, Taos. In northeast New Mexico, Mora. * WHEN...Until 445 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 139 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain south of Tres Ritos. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Angostura, Rito, North Fork Rio la Casa, Ca√±oncito Creek, Mora River, Casa, Rio la, Pueblo, Rio, Alamitos Creek, East Fork Rio Santa Barbara, Piedra Creek, Agua and Encinal Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southern Taos and West Central Mora Counties - This includes the following highways... State Road 518 between Mile Markers 43 and 49. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the northwest tip of the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon fire burn area.
